definition: to give a hollow laugh/to force a smile/forced laugh/CL:聲|声[sheng1]
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)

sentences.english: Lee said he was most obedient to his parents, then, he was a hollow laugh.
sentences.chinese: 李说他最听爸妈的话，任干笑了。

sentences.english: He forced a laugh to his shaking lips.
sentences.chinese: 他颤抖的两唇发出了一声干笑。

sentences.english: He gave a dry laugh, then sat down and started on the pastries.
sentences.chinese: 杜新箨说着干笑一声，坐下去就吃点心。

sentences.english: As she parted her lips in a mirthless smile, her even white teeth were bared as if ready to bite.
sentences.chinese: 她露出她的白牙齿干笑，那整齐的牙齿好像会咬人。

sentences.english: Jack snickered nervously and leaned back in his chair.
sentences.chinese: 杰克紧张地干笑了一声，仰身靠在椅背上。

definition: to put on a fake smile (idiom)/to smile insincerely
to force a smile/a bitter laugh
to laugh in spite of oneself/to be unable to help laughing/to break into laughter
to joke/to laugh insincerely/to make merry/to talk irrelevantly
like a smile yet not a smile (idiom)
